content.description:
This route is left of

Venus de Milo

, head up thin features to a small seam. Overhanging and thin for the duration of the route. Very close to being 13a.
content.location:
Scramble up the easy 5th class gully to the ledge. This is the 3rd line from the right on the

2nd buttress

.

content.description: Exciting climbing up a steep bolted face. One of the best on the wall, and a classic in the area!
content.location:
Found on the

Second Buttress

, scramble up 5.5 from trail to the head wall, its the beautiful line to the right of the wall.

content.description: A seldom climbed and unlisted route, can be found directly on the trail right before Flying Time and the Diving Board Area. Starts up a face protected by an old bolt and homemade hanger, then up a crack system that goes through several small roofs. Looks to be in the 5.10 range.
content.protection: Single rack (maybe doubles), wires, quickdraws, sling belay.
content.location: Route is on the same cliff section as Flying Time, located directly on the trail. It is just before the Diving Board clearing in the trail. Look for an old bolt on your right.

content.description:
The most popular climb on the

Second Buttress

, and a good one to start or end the day, or take some friends up. Starts up a face to a small stance, then up a straight in crack to pull two roofs. Look out for the pleasant surprises!
content.protection: Single rack to 2", stoppers, a few quickdraws and runners, chain anchors.
content.location:
This is the farthest route to the left up the slab on the

2nd buttress

, marked by a few bolts to start and a crack that heads through a roof.

content.description: I Cling is just left after scrambling to boardwalk ledge. Start up the large left facing corner that heads up to a roof. Clip the bolt, pull the roof, and then trend right up to gear belay.
content.protection: Singles to 2", stoppers, quickdraws, gear belay. Top out and walk off to the right.
content.location: Route is located just left of Venus Fly Trap and right of Ball and Chain. Heads up left facing corner at the start of the boardwalk ledge.

content.description: This route starts up an awkward slab to a large ledge. Shake out here and then start into the roof on a mix of jugs, slopers, and crimps. Good beta will make the crux seem much easier than without it, but thats half the fun. Cut your feet at the top for some amazing flying time! This was a top rope for years. Bolted in mid 90's
content.location: This route is not part of the second buttress proper, But just downhill. You will pass it as you take the approach trail up to the wall. Close proximity to the main trail, look for a large roof on the right. Belay from ledge at the base of the climb.

content.description: Route heads up the face to join the arete. Slap up the arete and use the face holds on your right, a lot of tension moves.
content.protection: Quickdraws, chain anchors, some of the bolt have chains for hangers.
content.location:
The furthest route to the right on the

Second Buttress

, right of

Venus de Milo

.

content.description: A short route to the left of Captain Ging. Heads up a clean face to pull a roof. Not a frequented climb.
content.location: From the right side of the Second Buttress, scramble to the top and then head up and right to the next cliffband. This route is the left of the 2 routes.

content.description: This short route climbs a bolted arete to right of Charlie's Overhang. Easier variations are possible on the same bolt line. Probably a seldom visited route, although a good climb.
content.location: From the right side of the Second Buttress, scramble to the top and then head up and right to the next cliffband. Look for the short bolted arete.

content.description: Climb the left facing corner to a small stance on the left and the head up face trending right. Pull the small roof then head to the anchors.
content.location:
This route is located to the right of

Pleasant Surprise

. Look for the bolt line that heads up the steep and thin corner on the left side of boardwalk ledge.
